faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is a Power of Attorney (POA)?
items.answer: A POA is a legal document that grants someone you trust the authority to act on your behalf for property, business, or personal matters, ensuring your affairs are handled even when you’re unavailable.

items.question: What types of POA can I get?
items.answer: We draft UAE-compliant General POAs, Property POAs, Business POAs, Vehicle POAs, and Family/Child POAs, each tailored to your specific needs.

items.question: Why do I need a POA in Dubai?
items.answer: A POA simplifies property, financial, and legal transactions, prevents delays, and ensures your assets and interests are legally protected, especially if you’re abroad.

items.question: How long does the POA drafting process take?
items.answer: Most standard POAs are drafted within 2–3 business hours, with revisions included, so you get a legally sound document quickly.

items.question: What documents do I need to provide?
items.answer: Typically, we need identification documents (passport or Emirates ID), details of the principal and agent, and transaction-specific information, depending on the POA type.
